alert.note: Alert for Salt Lake (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 3:33PM MDT until May 04 at 12:08PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Utah... Emigration Creek In Emigration Canyon and east bench of Salt Lake City affecting Salt Lake County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For Emigration Creek on the east bench of Salt Lake City...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday evenings. * WHERE...Emigration Creek In Emigration Canyon and east bench of Salt Lake City. * WHEN...Until early Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 130.0 cfs, minor flood damage will impact homes and structures along Emigration Creek, including areas of the Hogle Zoo. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM MDT Monday the flow was 109.0 cfs. - Emigration Creek has likely reached its minimum flow for the day and will start increasing again this afternoon and evening. - Forecast...Emigration Creek will continue to see increases in flow each evening to above flood flow, or 130 CFS, through at least Wednesday night, with the highest peaks forecast at 167 CFS. - Flood flow is 130.0 cfs. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 600 AM MDT.
